text: so I have a question my question is what

age is only a concept most people
especially the older generation don't
know their date of birth she's guessing
that she was born in the people on May
and they only have a general idea of
what their ages how is this possible why
don't people here know their own
birthday the reason is because the
Bhutanese genuinely believed that
leading a happy life is more important
than how many years you've been alive so
instead of recognizing individual
birthdays they've decided that all
citizens officially become one year
older every January first on New Year's
Day so January 1st you get one year
older okay I guess that makes it easier
to never forget anyone's birthday it's
always on the same day every year
however the younger generation
especially those who live in cities do
keep track of their birthdays as they
are slowly adapting to the Western world
but their age is not the same as you
think tearing and I are both 27 he was
born on 16 February in 1992 and I was
born on may 24th 1991 how are we the
same age in Bhutan immediately when a
person is born they are 1 and contrary
to the Western world where you begin
life at zero this means if you are born
at 11:59 p.m. on December 31st just one
minute after taking your first breath
you turn to so if you ever find yourself
in Bhutan and someone asks you your age
your birthday make sure you are prepared
